forecaster.canada.constants module¶

Constant values used by the application to describe, e.g., tax brackets, research data describing safe withdrawal rates, contribution room accrual rates, and other non-user-modifiable constants.

forecaster.canada.forecaster module¶

Provides a Canada-specific implementation of Forecaster.

class forecaster.canada.forecaster.ForecasterCanada(*args, settings=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.forecaster.Forecaster

Tests Forecaster (Canada).

__init__(*args, settings=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Inits Forecaster with Canada-specific settings.

In addition to using a Canada-specific Settings object by default, this class also provides Canada-specific defaults and init logic for RRSPs, TFSAs, TaxableAccounts, and Tax objects.

forecaster.canada.tax module¶

A module providing Canada-specific tax treatment.

class forecaster.canada.tax.TaxCanada(inflation_adjust, province='BC', payment_timing='start')[source]¶

Bases: object

Federal and provincial tax treatment for a Canadian resident.

inflation_adjust¶

A method with the following form: inflation_adjust(target_year, base_year) -> Decimal. See documentation for Tax for more information.

province¶

The province in which income tax is paid.

Type

str

__call__(income, year, other_federal_deduction=None, other_federal_credit=None, other_provincial_deduction=None, other_provincial_credit=None)[source]¶

Determines Canadian taxes owing on given income sources.

This includes provincial and federal taxes.

Parameters

  • income (Money, Person, iterable) – Taxable income for the year, either as a single scalar Money object, a single Person object, or as an iterable (list, set, etc.) of Person objects.

  • year (int) – The taxation year. This determines which tax rules and inflation-adjusted brackets are used.

  • other_federal_deduction (Money, dict[Person, Money]) – Deductions to be applied against federal taxes. See documentation for Tax for more.

  • other_federal_credit (Money, dict[Person, Money]) – Credits to be applied against federal taxes. See documentation for Tax for more.

  • other_provincial_deduction (Money, dict[Person, Money]) – Deductions to be applied against provincial taxes. See documentation for Tax for more.

  • other_provincial_credit (Money, dict[Person, Money]) – Credits to be applied against provincial taxes. See documentation for Tax for more.

Returns

The total amount of tax owing for the year.

Return type

Money

__init__(inflation_adjust, province='BC', payment_timing='start')[source]¶

Initializes TaxCanada.

Parameters

  • inflation_adjust –

    A method with the following form: inflation_adjust(target_year, base_year) -> Decimal.

    Can be passed as dict or Decimal-convertible scalar, which will be converted to a callable object.

    See documentation for Tax for more information.

  • province (str) – The province in which income tax is paid.

  • payment_timing (Decimal, str) – Timing for tax refunds and payments. See Tax documentation for more information.

marginal_bracket(taxable_income, year)[source]¶

The top tax bracket that taxable_income falls into.

marginal_rate(taxable_income, year)[source]¶

The marginal rate for the given income.

property payment_timing¶

Timing for refunds and payments.

class forecaster.canada.tax.TaxCanadaJurisdiction(inflation_adjustments, jurisdiction='Federal', payment_timing='start')[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.tax.Tax

Federal or provincial tax treatment (Canada).

credits(person, year, deductions=None)[source]¶

Finds tax credit available for each taxpayer.

Parameters

  • person (Person) – A person with some number of accounts (or other tax sources).

  • year (int) – The year in which money is expressed (used for inflation adjustment)

  • deductions (Money) – The deductions for which the person is eligible.

Returns

The tax credit available in this jurisdiction for

the person.

Return type

Money

Module contents¶

Extends Forecaster to process Canadian personal finance data.
